sentiment_score_definition: x <= -0.35: Bearish; -0.35 < x <= -0.15: Somewhat-Bearish; -0.15 < x < 0.15: Neutral; 0.15 <= x < 0.35: Somewhat_Bullish; x >= 0.35: Bullish
relevance_score_definition: 0 < x <= 1, with a higher score indicating higher relevance.

feed.title: K Wave Media to Acquire Controlling Stake in KOSDAQ-Listed AI and ICT Company Hansol Inticube
feed.summary: K Wave Media (KWM) has announced its binding agreement to acquire a 42.25% controlling stake in Hansol Inticube, a KOSDAQ-listed AI language and software development company. This acquisition, expected to close in Q1 2026, aims to integrate Hansol Inticube's AI and ICT solutions with KWM's global entertainment IP to enhance fan engagement and IP monetization. KWM anticipates this strategic move will significantly contribute to its revenue and solidify its transition into an "EnterTech" company by expanding into AI solutions, fan communities, and data-driven content distribution.

feed.title: K Wave Media to Acquire Controlling Stake in KOSDAQ-Listed AI and ICT Company Hansol Inticube
feed.summary: K Wave Media (KWM) announced its binding agreement to acquire a 42.25% controlling stake in Hansol Inticube Co., Ltd., a KOSDAQ-listed AI language and software development company. This acquisition, expected to close in Q1 2026, aims to integrate AI and ICT solutions with KWM's entertainment IP and fandom models, transforming fan engagement and IP monetization. KWM anticipates significant revenue contribution from Hansol Inticube, supporting its goal of doubling revenue in 2026 and solidifying its transition into an "EnterTech" company.

feed.title: K Wave Media to Acquire Controlling Stake in KOSDAQ-Listed AI and ICT Company Hansol Inticube
feed.summary: K Wave Media Ltd. (Nasdaq: KWM), a global entertainment and media company, announced its binding agreement to acquire a 42.25% controlling stake in Hansol Inticube Co., Ltd., a KOSDAQ-listed AI language and software development company. This acquisition, expected to close in Q1 2026, aims to integrate Hansol Inticube's AI and ICT solutions with K Wave Media's entertainment IP to transform fan engagement and IP monetization, positioning KWM as an "EnterTech" company. K Wave Media anticipates this strategic move will significantly contribute to its consolidated financial performance and help double its revenue in 2026.

feed.title: K Wave Media issues update highlighting SEC clearance, acquisition
feed.summary: K Wave Media Ltd. announced on December 18, 2025, that it has received SEC clearance and completed an acquisition. The update highlights positive developments for the company, following its previous announcement in September about launching an entertainment tokenization platform with Galaxy Digital. K Wave Media also recently appointed Yong Fang as Chief Financial Officer and has been active in mergers and acquisitions, including the purchase of a 55% stake in Rabbit Walk Inc.

feed.title: K Wave Media (Nasdaq: KWM) names Yong Fang CFO, with IPO and RTO public listing experience
feed.summary: K Wave Media (Nasdaq: KWM) has appointed Yong (Howard) Fang as its new Chief Financial Officer, effective November 4, 2025. Fang brings extensive experience in capital markets, investor relations, financial reporting, and compliance, including leading two companies through IPO and RTO processes. His previous role was CFO of Baijiayun Group (Nasdaq: RTC), and he will be instrumental in K Wave Media's expansion and enhancing shareholder value.

feed.title: KWM Stock Price and Chart — NASDAQ:KWM
feed.summary: This article provides a detailed overview of K Wave Media, Ltd. (NASDAQ: KWM) stock performance, key financial metrics, and company information. It includes price changes over various periods, market capitalization, dividend information, and answers to frequently asked questions regarding the stock.

feed.title: K Wave Media (NASDAQ:KWM) Trading Down 11% - Time to Sell?
feed.summary: K Wave Media (NASDAQ:KWM) experienced an 11% drop in its share price during Friday's trading, closing at $2.18 after opening at $2.45. Trading volume was down 20% from the daily average. An institutional investor, Vontobel Holding Ltd., recently acquired a new stake in the company, purchasing 16,419 shares valued at approximately $40,000, bringing institutional ownership to 62.18%.

feed.title: We need 'paradigm shift in how Korean content is created,' K Wave Media CEO says
feed.summary: Ted Kim, CEO and co-founder of K Wave Media (KWM), argues for a "paradigm shift" in Korean content creation, emphasizing the need for production studios to retain intellectual property (IP) rights and gain greater financial control. KWM, the first Korean multi-entertainment company listed on Nasdaq, aims to achieve this by funding a larger portion of productions with its own capital. Additionally, Kim advocates for diversified distribution networks and international coproductions to elevate Korean content globally.

feed.title: Bitcoin (BTC) Treasury News: K Wave Media Aims to Be Korea's Metaplanet
feed.summary: K Wave Media, a South Korean firm, announced plans to raise up to $500 million through common stock sales to fund a corporate Bitcoin treasury strategy, aiming to become the "Korean Metaplanet." The company's shares surged 155% on the news. K Wave Media intends to acquire and hold Bitcoin long-term, operate Lightning Network nodes, and invest in Bitcoin-native infrastructure for yield optimization and decentralized transaction rewards.
